##15 days of travel shock

Micro-signal, Rancaijing

A feature presentation, a daily in depth report, redefines the innovation economy.

The "guide to the war and epidemic of innovative economy" is a special column launched by Finance and Economics during the epidemic of new type of pneumonia. It focuses on the new problems encountered by enterprises of Innovative Economy and discusses the new countermeasures that should be taken, hope to be able to help small and medium-sized enterprises together to overcome challenges and seize opportunities. This is the 6th issue. Read the first five, please Click "which industries are bucking the trend? " "SME survival guide" "almost fallen fresh e-commerce stand up again" "Valentine's Day file, also gone" "offline education press the "pause button" .

By Kong Mingming

Editor | Zhou Changfan

The 2020 Spring Festival was supposed to be a bumper harvest, according to many in the travel industry. But an epidemic has changed the travel plans of more than 400 million people and caused huge losses for more than 10 million people in the travel industry.

Since the announcement of the "city closure" in Wuhan on January 23, the Civil Aviation Administration, the railway administration, the Ministry of Culture and Tourism and other relevant departments have issued a series of circulars, within the required time, the ticket can be refunded free of charge, the group travel can be stopped, the "machine + wine" service including outbound travel can be stopped, the scenic spots can be closed, the group gathering activities are prohibited... Every day, every piece of information is published, for all the people in the travel industry, the impact is huge.

In the meantime, entrepreneurs stay up all night, customer service workers work more than 12 hours a day, resort operators cry, travel agency guides wait at home to resume work, Ota platforms placate users and suppliers and constantly have to pad huge sums of money.

"There are more than 20,000 travel agencies, 400,000 to 500,000 employees, more than 100,000 hotels, close to a million accommodation facilities, and almost all of them have come to a standstill overnight. Overall, the tourism industry alone lost $1 trillion in gross domestic product during the Spring Festival holiday. There are more than 10 million people working in hotels, scenic spots, airlines and so on, and they will be unemployed for the next three to four months,"Wu Zhixiang, founder of the Tongcheng Group, said in a live public service broadcast.

For the tourism industry, by the population gathering, seasonal, social and other factors, Spring Festival travel and tourism can basically account for the annual revenue of Tourism companies about 1 / 4. According to figures released by the China Tourism Research Institute, China received 415 million tourists during the Spring Festival holiday in 2019, bringing in 513.9 billion yuan in tourism revenue.

"based on an optimistic estimate, if the three-month closing period is reduced by 60 percent and the three-month recovery period is reduced by 30 percent, the national tourism industry is expected to lose nearly 3 trillion yuan this year, " Wu Bihu, director of the Tourism Research and Planning Center at Peking University, said in an interview with the media.

Everyone knows that after an epidemic, the travel industry is bound to experience "retaliatory" outbreaks and growth. But according to data from a joint survey by Tsinghua University and Peking University, 34 per cent of small and medium-sized enterprises can only keep their balance on their books for one month, 33.1 per cent for two months and 17.91 per cent for three months.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
How long can the balance of small and medium-sized enterprises be maintained

Source Central European Business Review

Head of the platform for the introduction of low-interest loans to suppliers, investors said this is a good opportunity for enterprises to practice and calm thinking, practitioners to rethink the business model and concurrent force line. At the same time, a number of interviewees also told CNFC that they were planning to communicate with the Ministry of Culture and Tourism to request more support and help from the government.

"Spring will always come" , in the suffering of waiting, while struggling to save themselves, while consoling themselves.

A sudden outbreak

On Jan. 23,51BOOK's CEO, Yang Rui, was still at the company.

51BOOK, an online booking platform with an annual turnover of around $4 billion, had nearly $20 million in transactions that day, had completed its monthly KPI ahead of schedule, and he and his staff held a small celebration for it at the company. With the company's overall business growing at 40% in 2019, they are looking forward to 2020.

But all joy and hope came to an abrupt end on the night of the 23rd.

On the evening of January 23, the Civil Aviation Administration announced that since the 24th, passengers who had purchased a civil aviation ticket before may voluntarily refund the ticket free of charge. At that time Yang Rui and many practitioners in the industry rushed to set up a wechat group, in the group hurriedly discuss countermeasures. "At that time, we only knew that the business could not be done, there would be a large number of teams to cancel the air tickets, the original idea of making money during the peak season during the Spring Festival was completely defeated. Maybe it was not a matter of losing money, but a matter of considering the survival of the enterprise, " Yang said.

Before Jan. 25, Yang Wei, founder of a Parent Child Ota Platform in Sichuan Province, and many vendors were preparing for the Spring Festival crowd. According to last year's estimate, the entire Spring Festival tourism market in Sichuan alone has nearly 80,000 people mobile, Temple Fair, Lantern Festival, parent-child activities are ready and ready to go.

A little later than the ticket platform, Yang Wei and his suppliers received an urgent call directly from the local government on the 25th. The telephone message was that all scenic spots and cultural radio and television spots in Sichuan Province would be closed from January 25, and large mass gatherings would be suspended.

In 2019, Yang Wei's company's revenue was about 200 million yuan, and the golden period of the Spring Festival is scheduled to account for 30 percent of the company's annual revenue. "When I first received the news of the epidemic, I didn't expect it to be so serious. On the 23rd, I just dealt with some situations in the Wuhan Branch Office. " On the evening of the New Year's Eve, my family had a New Year's Eve dinner, yang Wei was alone in his room, making phone calls.

Like Yang Wei, to buy tickets CEO Zhang Hanfeng 23 in the friends circle to see Wuhan "closed city" News, thinking "Bad, Hubei scenic area certainly can not open. As a start up that provides SAAS management software for scenic spots, they have more than 2,400 scenic spots customers over the past four years. In the three days leading up to the Spring Festival, their daily turnover is running at around 120 million yuan.

And in the 25th scenic area closed notice issued, to buy tickets customers began to close attractions, users began to refund tickets. Their daily flow had dropped to more than 4 million yuan on the 26th. "My heart is cold, " Zhang Hanfeng said, "We have a temple fair client in Hebei Province who lost more than 200 million yuan in initial investment, and even one client in the Huahai scenic area collapsed, making her eyes glaze over. "

Image / visual China

For the tourism industry, crowded, timeliness is very important, "even if the epidemic has passed, people can not take seven days off in a row, for scenic spots, time is money, the entire loss is irreparable, " Zhang said.

Large Otas are faster than industry players because of their wider coverage.

On January 20, the founder of Hornet's nest, Chen Gang, was still working on the company's year-end inventory of some key projects when reports of the outbreak began to appear in the media, although "public awareness of the affected area is still at an early stage. " However, Chen Gang realized that "the outbreak is not so simple, " the same night, Chen Gang also stressed that the Spring Festival period customer service, technology and other departments on duty.

Chen Gang said that when he flew home on the 21st, he saw that many people in Beijing Capital International Airport had already put on face masks, and that the amount of private messages on his personal micro blog on that day had reached almost 20 times the normal level, according to the company's customer service data, incoming calls are skyrocketing.

You Qingji, a multi-investor in tourism projects and a partner in the yuan Ti Evergreen Fund, said that on January 21, he had started talking to some of the major investment companies to remind them that the outbreak could be a big blow to the tourism industry, prepare for the worst.

CTRIP related business leaders told Caijing that they had started the internal early warning on January 20, usually more than 20 people of the warning wechat group name was changed to "Wuhan pneumonia warning. ". At noon on the 21st, CTRIP issued a "special withdrawal and Reform Policy" in response to the epidemic. After that, Meituan, flying pigs, the same journey elong, Hornet's nest and so on have followed.

Since January 23rd, the whole travel industry seems to have hit the "pause" and "Hard mode" buttons.

One million rejection orders

"It's impossible to react. The epidemic is developing too fast, " said Meng Lei, the founder of Royal Charter travel.

On January 24, the Ministry of Culture and tourism announced the suspension of all group tours and "machine + wine" tourism products. On January 26, the Ministry of Culture and Tourism announced that all group tours and "machine + wine" services, including outbound tours, would be suspended. "starting from the 24th, the entire tourism industry has started not sleeping and is busy with refunds, " Meng said.

From January 24 to 27, "day and night rush, carrying the rice bowl is still in the meeting, " said Meng Lei, thinking about tears, "everyone goes to bed at four or five o'clock in the morning and gets up again at around eight or nine o'clock in the morning, " he said. As for the main business of overseas chinese-language shuttle flights, chartered buses and custom-made tours of the Imperial Chartered Bus Tours, in the evening, it is necessary to communicate with overseas partners, during the day to communicate with customers, "we are in the overall state of near collapse. ".

"Do you know what it's like to return to wechat every day and get a fever on your finger? And every message from our travel agency and other merchants is asking me: Why don't we get a refund? What do we do if we don't get a refund? " Meng said.

From the first day to the third day, Zhang Hanfeng, who had only 11 people on duty, temporarily mobilized staff to work from home, returned more than 3 million tickets to scenic spots, "At that time, WE USED ALL OUR R & D personnel as aftersales, all of them stayed online, and actively contacted customers whether they needed us to help them in the back for bulk refunds. " Within a few days, the daily flow of tickets dropped from 120 million yuan to more than 100,000 yuan, "A precipitous fall" .

Yang Rui said, the first day of their refund of about 15,000, the third doubled, to the sixth day of their daily backlog of refund has been more than 60,000, involving hundreds of millions of funds.

"This situation is unprecedented for the entire tourism industry and for China as a whole, " Chen Gang told Rencai. In addition to mobilizing company-wide efforts to ease customer pressure, he even responded to most of his users'private messages on Weibo, helping them to withdraw and improve their operations while appealing for their understanding and support, "You can only get three to four hours of sleep a day. "

For OTAS, the pressure to cancel has been felt even earlier. On the night of January 20th, "according to current information, there must be human-to-human transmission of COVID-19 pneumonia, " Zhong Nanshan, a member of the Chinese Academy of Engineering and head of the high-level Expert Group of the National Health Commission, told CCTV news for the first time, customer Service calls and cancellations started pouring in.

"At the beginning of the hotel retreat is a single discussion, customers call in, we negotiate with the hotel, " CTRIP CEO Sun Jie said. As the outbreak spread, it quickly spread from Wuhan to the rest of the country, filling customer service lines. "At the beginning of the surge, thousands of people were lining up online, and everyone was cursing why CTRIP's phone couldn't get through. " CTRIP related business said.

CTRIP 22 overnight online hotel "peace of mind to cancel protection" plan, so that users can self-cancellation online, without the need to go through manual customer service. For the participating hotels, ctrip has promised to highlight them in its main APP, giving them tags including post-epidemic "Love Hotel" and 100 million marketing resources after the outbreak ends, with 400,000 hotels already participating in the program.

Business had not yet spread overseas, "but we also made the assumption that almost all the major hotel groups would be contacted, and eventually the six major global groups would join first, and other local hotels overseas would follow, " Sun said.

It is understood that the flying pig platform during the Spring Festival customer service hotline peak reached 10 times the same period last year. Data from CTRIP also showed that the total number of requests and inquiries received by ctrip platform as of January 29 had reached several million orders of magnitude, up 405% from last spring festival and up 650% from the peak, the average customer service shift is 13 hours. Tongcheng elong related person in charge said that in order to deal with the epidemic brought about the retreat, Tongcheng elong almost all available customer service manpower on duty.

But none of this will ease the customer service pressure from one million cancellations.

"The authorities have introduced 11 policies in the days following the outbreak, each of which will trigger a new wave of cancellations and orders that will double in number and take time to complete, " CTRIP officials said, "because of the special nature of free refunds, it takes a certain amount of time to sort through submissions, reviews and refunds, and when the volume of refunds suddenly explodes and airlines and other relevant companies have not even had time to draw up policies, the backlog of reviews will only get longer. "

"A lot of customer service people will put their headphones out of their ears before they answer the phone, explain after the customer has scolded them, and even give their customers a refund first, " said the person in charge, "The demand for international refunds remains high due to the suspension of flights by overseas airlines and the policies of various governments to restrict the entry of Chinese citizens, and it is expected to take one to two weeks to clear up. "

Save Yourself, save yourself, save yourself

Back orders are still not stopped, the industry temporarily shut down, cash flow is this time all enterprises focus.

Previously, Qunar CEO Chen Gang told the media that "not only is cash flow tight on the platform, but also on the agencies and even the airlines" , go where net each business line already advances capital for consumer instant refund nearly 100 million yuan, Chen Gang says Ma Fengwo also advances capital for consumer unsubscribe already exceeded 500 million yuan.

Yang Wei said that if the company still can not run after six months, ready to go through the liquidation process. "The industry upstream and downstream enterprises are almost completely locked in funds, pessimism, anxiety, helplessness is spreading to every tourist, " Yang said.

In response to the difficulties faced by various sectors, local governments have started to introduce subsidies and support policies, but many interviewees said that these policies are still difficult to quickly hit the ground.

"You have to save yourself first, " Yang Wei said.

Starting on January 26, Yang Wei convened a series of online meetings with company executives and sent an e mail to all employees on January 30, informing them of the need to optimize the company's workforce and suspend new operations for 2020, can transfer the post of the staff can choose to transfer, otherwise they choose to leave. "There's nothing we can do. If we don't do this, the company will go to hell. " So far, his company has optimized nearly a third of its personnel.

On the other hand, Yang Wei's company, which used to rely more on offline business, is now considering a gradual shift to online business, developing products to meet the needs of c-end users and "making some changes to the original business model. "

On January 28, after nearly processing all of the company's return orders, Meng Lei finally breathed a sigh of relief, start thinking about how to save themselves, how to arrange staff, how to pay wages, how to repay bank loans, how to raise funds and so on. "from January 28 until now, my daily job has been to talk to investors, partners and employees. ".

"At present, banks may delay the repayment of loans, but most of the partners are from abroad and it is difficult to communicate with them, " Meng said, "I talked to the employees about a salary delay, and some of them told me that their family had just given birth to a second child a few months ago. What do you have the nerve to say at this time? I just sent it to you. Can you say a second sentence? You can't say it. "

Although the company has completed a C + round of financing and has more than a dozen investors, "it's very unlikely that investors will make a move at the moment, because they have hundreds of investment projects. Who Will they help? " In the process, Meng said, the hardest thing for him was, "If something can be changed through hard work, we can work on it. But there's not a crack left for us. "

Youchianji also believes that in the first half of the year, almost all investment in the tourism industry will be frozen, no one dares to sell, and even if someone does, it will be companies in other industries with cash flows, but at that time "it is acquisition rather than investment" . "for travel companies, if it's a very difficult process to do, I suggest selling it as soon as you have a chance to be acquired, " you said.

Zhang Hanfeng now thinks of ways to help scenic spots do discount pre-sale, recover some of the cash flow; or there are Ip scenic spots, through online marketing or interactive games, to obtain customers. For different categories, to buy tickets to customers into different categories, there are indoor, outdoor, event theme, skiing, to give them a different program. The company can only be online if your customers are online.

In an internal letter sent to employees on February 2, Ji Qi, the founder of China Residential Group, said that the company's current strategy is not to lay off employees and not to encourage the closure of stores. But this response is based on the 2-3 months or so the basic end of the epidemic or have been effectively controlled as a hypothesis.

Jiqi said that under normal circumstances, the human cost of the front-line employees in Huazhu stores is about 6,000 yuan per person per month, 100,000 employees, or 600 million per month. If the outbreak worsens, or if it lasts longer than 3 months, the employment situation may need to be further adjusted. Such as transfer, part of the work, only the basic salary, suspended payment of social security pension insurance.

Just get through it. Stay alive

At the same time, the head platform for the industry to do what it can.

CTRIP launched a $100 million insurance plan after a nationwide demand for unsubscribing began to emerge. On January 26, after the Ministry of Culture and tourism announced a nationwide suspension of domestic and overseas package tours and "air ticket + hotel" semi-self-service travel products, CTRIP raised the guarantee amount to 200 million. CTRIP rolled out such products before February 29, previously has been ordered by the free line, play, car, custom tour, scenic spots and other products returned intact. Consumer refunds are all paid for by CTRIP, suppliers submit supporting documents according to their losses, and CTRIP bears part of the cost loss; on January 29, CTRIP announced a three-month management fee reduction for its 8,000 CTRIP travel agency franchises, extended quota.

Some practitioners said that CTRIP requires suppliers to provide loss proof materials, suppliers are difficult to provide, and worry that CTRIP will not return real money but in the form of advertising fees, "But I can not hold on to that day, the cash flow has been cut off. " CTRIP said that the loss certificate material is to help suppliers negotiate losses, it is not difficult to provide, such as air tickets, hotels and other booking documents.

Others say that Otas are pursuing "unsubscribe as best they can" in pursuit of more corporate social responsibility, in fact raising the bar for the industry as a whole, and making it easier for suppliers and platforms, start A long-term collision and communication on the new rules.

On February 5, CTRIP announced the launch of the "Tongpao" program to its partners in the fields of air tickets, hotels, tourism and vacations on its platform, including 10 specific measures, 1 billion yuan in partner support funds and 10 billion yuan in micro loans, on February 6th Huazu announced it was urgently opening up low interest loans to its hotels, which have been open for more than a year and are still in business, huazu can provide low-interest loans of up to 500,000 yuan for individual stores.

And for many people in the travel industry, how to solve the immediate livelihood is also a big problem. "there is basically no base salary for tour guides, " said one travel agency founder. "Some old guides can make a living selling special products at home, while the new guides may not have any income, " said another. "The industry is so dependent on the weather that it even wants to change careers. ". On February 5, the Ministry of Culture and tourism launched a program to temporarily withdraw part of the quality guarantee for travel agencies, which is undoubtedly a good thing for travel agency practitioners.

According to Liang Jianzhang, the first phase of the tourism industry's response to the epidemic was to handle user services and follow up on massive orders, while the second phase was a bleak one, "How to ensure the stability of the team and the company's financial situation is a problem that enterprises need to face at this stage, " Liang said.

During the SARS period 17 years ago, CTRIP retained almost all of its employees and operated on a rotational basis. At the same time, taking advantage of the business downturn, CTRIP conducted a lot of internal training and business process optimization, enhancing the competence of employees. And in the first month after the end of SARS, the tourism industry ushered in a "retaliatory growth. ". In December of that year, ctrip rang the bell on Nasdaq.

"with reference to the SARS situation, the tourism industry will definitely see a business boom after the outbreak. But before this, there will definitely be some companies business shutdown and capital drying up, all sides are testing their own comprehensive strength,"Yang said.

For 51BOOK, 2015 air ticket agency industry "directly reduce generation" policy, the impact is even greater than this epidemic. "It was as bad for the industry as the earthquake, two-thirds of the companies were basically wiped out and the epidemic was only a phase. In 2015, the company raised 438 million yuan in a 51BOOK downturn, and it still has hundreds of millions of yuan in cash on its books. In theory, as long as we keep our business steady, customer service good, retain, at least a year."

Pexels

Yang told Caijing that from the outbreak, they also found that the company has a lot to reflect on. For example, the handling of business peak estimate is not enough, some business sector risk-resistant capacity is not enough, "in the future we will strengthen cross-industry investment in the business layout and overseas business investment, to hedge the risk of the tourism industry. "

"For many tour companies, this outbreak is also a touchstone, " you said. In his view, the cash flow management of the tourism industry is complicated because of the large amount of advances and receipts, which is different from that of the general manufacturing and service industries, "The founders of the travel industry, the vast majority of people don't understand the concept of free cash flow, and a lot of startups that have gone out of business in the last five years have died on this point, " you said, "As things stand now, even the cash flow of big companies may not last six months if the epidemic is not effectively contained. "

Wu Zhixiang said during the "SARS" period, when all the offline travel stores were closed, the same journey became a platform for the travel industry to log on and gather. "The crisis is an equal opportunity for every business, and a fair number of businesses will die in the process of the fire, but only the more robust trees can sprout new shoots. "

On the evening of January 27, after having basically processed all the company's return orders, Meng Lei was finally free to face the company's current situation, "When people are busy, they just try to organize refunds, but when the problem is basically solved and they start counting the money they have, I basically collapse, " he says.

Founded in 2014, Royal Charter travel has come a long way in the face of challenges and difficulties until February 2019, when it just started to turn a profit. Meng had expected 2020 to be a banner year for the company.

In the middle of the night, 35-year-old Meng Lei knelt on the ground in his hometown in Shandong Province. Looking back on the years since he started his business at the age of 20, he felt mixed emotions and felt aggrieved and exhausted for a long time. On Jan. 28, he boarded a high-speed train back to Beijing, thinking, "one way or another, I have to carry it. I can carry it day by day. "

He has yet to see the "crack" that would solve the problem, but he is still trying to find various solutions. "The epidemic affects the industry in stages but does not destroy the industry because there is demand, there is pain, there is opportunity. What we can do now is to rest up and practice our inner strength, and wait for the 'retaliatory' rebound opportunity of mass travel after the epidemic, " Meng said.

* The caption is from visual China. At the request of the interviewee, Yang Wei was given a pseudonym.

On as if

Welcome to join the "burning finance and economic innovation economic war and epidemic plan" .

Under the epidemic situation, the industry changes, in order to help innovative enterprises overcome the challenges, seize the opportunity, finance and economics launched the "innovative economic war epidemic plan. ". The program consists of three parts: column reporting, online salons, and industry communities.

The report section and the online salon section invite entrepreneurs and investors who want to contribute to the innovation economy and help overcome the difficulties, to participate in the report, discussion and mutual assistance. You are welcome to leave a message in the comments area or send us a private message backstage. Please indicate "entrepreneur" or "investor" .

Industry community section, attention to this topic, would like to participate in the community readers, welcome in the background message US, marked "Plan" , into the group after we will provide a discussion platform, Salon live broadcast and other follow-up services.
